issues.title: Custom Metadata Support for Workers in Temporal UI and CLI
issues.author: deepika-awasthi
issues.summary: Feature request to add custom metadata support for workers in Temporal, allowing users to attach operational information like environment, version, and team ownership that can be viewed in the UI and CLI.

issues.title: [Bug] Use `pnpm` when building TS worker from source
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK has migrated from npm to pnpm for builds, but the features repo still uses npm when building TS workers from source. This causes `npm ci` to fail because it expects package-lock.json but pnpm uses pnpm-lock.yaml instead.

issues.title: Support non-workflow activities
issues.author: maciejdudko
issues.summary: Feature request to support executing activities without a workflow context. Clients and workers need new APIs to start, manage, and retrieve activity results independently of workflows.

issues.title: Warn if SDK detects a workflow history over a certain size
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to add SDK warnings when workflow history exceeds a configurable size threshold, emitted once per workflow and only during execution (not replay) to alert users before the server terminates workflows.

issues.title: Support setting of Temporal Headers through CLI / GUI
issues.author: Tamoghnasen9
issues.summary: Feature request to support setting Temporal headers through CLI and GUI for workflow restarts. Currently, headers set by ContextPropagator are lost when restarting failed workflows from the GUI.

issues.title: Add activity_fail_endtoend_latency metric
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to add activity_fail_endtoend_latency metric to complement the existing activity_succeed_endtoend_latency metric, allowing users to monitor activity failures after all retries without needing custom metrics.

issues.title: Warn if the SDK tried to send a payload above a specific size
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: SDKs should warn users when they attempt to send payloads exceeding a configurable size threshold (default 512 KB), similar to server-side warnings. This helps users catch payload size violations early on the client side before requests fail.

issues.title: Worker Heartbeating
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Implement a worker heartbeating mechanism that allows users to query worker information from the server, enabling better worker debugging and visibility into runtime status across namespaces and clients.

issues.title: Set `GrpcMessageTooLarge` as `failure_reason` for workflow task failed metric
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for setting `GrpcMessageTooLarge` as a failure reason on the `temporal_workflow_task_execution_failed` metric when workflow tasks fail due to gRPC message size limits. This enhancement should help users identify and diagnose large message issues without significantly increasing metric cardinality.

issues.title: Allow overriding of the Worker Deployment Version when invoking a Child Workflow.
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Allow users to override the Worker Deployment Version when invoking a Child Workflow, enabling pre-deployment testing scenarios. This feature should work the same way as version override does when creating a Workflow from a client.

issues.title: Nexus samples and docs should not encourage using request ID for workflow ID
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Nexus samples and documentation currently use request ID as workflow ID, which contradicts the documented best practice of using business-meaningful IDs. The request is to update samples and docs to demonstrate proper workflow ID usage.

issues.title: Deployment feature tests failing in Go docker build
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Deployment versioning feature tests are timing out during Go docker builds, failing multiple routing-related test scenarios including auto-upgrade, pinned versions, overrides, and ramp deployments.

issues.title: Assume TLS enabled if API key provided in SDKs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Assume TLS is enabled when an API key is provided in SDKs to improve security by default. This is a backwards-incompatible change that affects self-hosted deployments without TLS, requiring explicit configuration to disable TLS when using API keys.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Omit HostedMCPTool headers from serialized activity input?
issues.author: nikhil-pandey
issues.summary: Feature request to prevent sensitive HTTP headers in HostedMCPTool from being serialized into activity input and visible in Temporal UI and worker logs. Users need a way to omit or lazily resolve these headers to avoid exposing secrets.

issues.title: Provide plugin implementations for contrib/extra integrations
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: SDKs should expose contrib/extra integrations (like OpenTelemetry) as plugin implementations, leveraging the plugin system introduced in #652 to standardize how integrations are configured across all Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: Add Nexus CONFLICT and REQUEST_TIMEOUT handler error types
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add support for Nexus CONFLICT and REQUEST_TIMEOUT handler error types across all Temporal SDKs as specified in the Nexus RPC specification.

issues.title: Remove fetchResult and fetchInfo from Nexus SDKs
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Remove fetchResult and fetchInfo APIs from Nexus SDKs across all languages. These APIs were recently removed from the Nexus RPC specification and need to be removed from the Go, Java, TypeScript, Python, and .NET SDK implementations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose client identity information to the Workflow
issues.author: TastyPi
issues.summary: User requests exposure of client identity information to workflows for auditing purposes. Currently, identity information is available in the WorkflowExecutionStarted event but workflows cannot access it without making additional API calls.

issues.title: Remove mentions of tctl from the SDKs
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Remove deprecated tctl references from SDK codebases (Go, Python, TypeScript) and replace them with CLI tool mentions, as tctl is no longer maintained.

issues.title: Nexus serialization context
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add Nexus service and operation information to the serialization context provided to converters and codecs, enabling users to access Nexus-specific metadata during serialization similar to existing workflow and activity context.

issues.title: [Feature request] Idempotency token for activity
issues.author: antstorm
issues.summary: Request for a unique identifier that persists across activity retries to enable idempotent activity execution. Currently, activities lack a globally unique identifier independent of workflow context, making it difficult to implement idempotency patterns.

issues.title: Append some details to error messages
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Standardize error messages across SDKs by appending non-'details' properties to failure messages for activity, child workflow, Nexus, timeout, and application failures. Some SDKs (Java, Go) already implement this partially, while others lack it entirely.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Optionally hide server startup banner
issues.author: DanielYang59
issues.summary: Feature request to optionally hide or suppress the Temporal server startup banner that appears in test logs. The banner displays CLI version, server info, and metrics URLs which clutters test output.

issues.title: [TS] Expose Temporal Nexus operation info to Temporal Nexus operation authors
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK needs to expose Temporal Nexus operation info (namespace and task queue) to Nexus operation authors, similar to how activity and workflow info are provided to their respective authors. This feature has been implemented in Go, Java, Python, and .NET SDKs but is still pending for TypeScript and Ruby/PHP (which don't have Nexus yet).

issues.title: SDKs should expose Nexus request deadline
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: All Temporal SDKs should expose the Nexus request deadline in the Nexus context. This provides a consistent way for developers to access request timeout information across all supported languages and is needed for proper deadline-aware programming.

issues.title: Ensure tests exist to confirm custom slot supplier slot info has proper fields
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add tests across SDKs that verify custom slot suppliers receive slot info objects with properly set fields. Currently most SDKs lack test coverage for this functionality.

issues.title: Ensure gRPC binary metadata keys are supported by clients
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Core SDKs need support for gRPC binary metadata keys (with `-bin` suffix) to allow passing bytes as RPC metadata values, matching native gRPC library capabilities. Currently, Core SDKs only support string values as ASCII headers, causing Tonic to fail when binary headers are attempted.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reclassify Benign Application errors in OpenTelemetry
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to reclassify benign application errors in OpenTelemetry across multiple SDKs. Exceptions should still be recorded in telemetry but not marked as errors to better distinguish between expected failures and actual problems.

issues.title: Add ability to set timer options like summary on higher-level timer calls
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add timer options (like summary) to higher-level timer calls such as `.sleep` and `.await`, currently only available on `.newTimer`. Implementation approach (TimerOptions, dedicated options classes, or overloads) to be determined.

issues.title: Add BadScheduleActivityAttributes failure_reason to temporal_workflow_task_execution_failed metric
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to add BadScheduleActivityAttributes failure_reason to the temporal_workflow_task_execution_failed metric to help differentiate failure causes, such as when activity payload exceeds size limits.

issues.title: Nexus samples and dev guide docs to map a Nexus Operation input to multiple Workflow arguments
issues.author: prasek
issues.summary: Users need clear documentation and samples showing how to map a single Nexus Operation input to multiple Workflow arguments. Currently this information is only available for Java SDK and scattered across Slack discussions, but should be documented across all SDK dev guides with consistent examples.

issues.title: Nexus samples and dev guide docs for sync Nexus ops that use signal, signal-with-start, update, query, ...
issues.author: prasek
issues.summary: Users need working Nexus operation examples and documentation for synchronous operations that interact with workflows (signals, signal-with-start, updates, queries) across SDKs. Currently examples are sparse or buried, making it unclear how to implement these patterns.

issues.title: Setting headers on LocalActivities not recorded on EventHistory
issues.author: gauravthadani
issues.summary: Feature request to record headers on LocalActivities in EventHistory. Currently, RecordMarkerCommandAttributes supports headers but they are not set for LocalActivities, preventing visibility in EventHistory as users have requested.

issues.title: Nexus operation testing environment
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Nexus operation authors need a testing environment to mock and trigger scenarios without server involvement, similar to the activity testing framework. This feature should be built into non-Temporal Nexus SDKs first, then integrated into Temporal SDKs across all language implementations.

issues.title: Provide extra/advanced details on start/execute workflow
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to provide additional metadata when starting or executing workflows, including whether a workflow actually started, its current status, whether it was eagerly started, and workflow links. Requires research into implementing mutable placeholders in start options across SDKs.

issues.title: Make metrics concerning unregistered activities (and maybe other things) consistent
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Establish consistent metrics for unregistered activities across all Temporal SDKs. Currently only Go implements temporal_unregistered_activity_invocation; this issue tracks standardizing this metric and potentially adding metrics for other unregistered operations across all SDK implementations.

issues.title: Support for user groups mapped to Entry ID security groups
issues.author: petrkoutnycz
issues.summary: User requests support for mapping Microsoft Entra ID security groups directly to Temporal namespace permissions instead of managing individual user access. This would simplify permission management in organizations using SSO with Entra ID.

issues.title: Plugins to support controlling multiple configuration points at once
issues.author: tconley1428
issues.summary: Feature request for a plugin model that allows users to configure multiple SDK configuration points at once (dataconverters, sandboxes, activities, interceptors, etc.) rather than having to set them individually.

issues.title: Add metric to indicate that poll rate is limited by client
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request for a metric to distinguish when poll rate is limited by client-side constraints (e.g., maximum parallel tasks reached) versus service latency or connection issues. This would help developers understand polling bottlenecks.

issues.title: Add ability to complete workflow from any line
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request for an API to complete or fail a workflow from any location, not just the @WorkflowMethod. Currently workflows can only be completed/failed from the main workflow method or by throwing exceptions.

issues.title: Add support for unit testing workflow versioning
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Feature request to enable unit testing of workflow versioning and upgrade scenarios. Currently, the unit testing framework always takes the code path of the latest version with no way to force execution of older code paths, making it impossible to verify that versioned code upgrades work correctly.

issues.title: Write tests for worker shutdown
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Create comprehensive test suite for worker shutdown functionality across all SDK languages to validate that activities properly handle graceful shutdown with varied responses (accept cancel, complete successfully, fail, or ignore cancel with hard timeout).

issues.title: Add unregistered_activity_invocation
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to add an unregistered_activity_invocation metric or indicator to track when workers fail to handle activities because they don't have the activity registered. Go SDK already has this metric; the feature request is to implement it across all non-Go SDKs.

issues.title: Add Summary to LocalActivityOptions
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to add a Summary field to LocalActivityOptions across all SDKs. This is a cross-SDK feature enhancement to provide better metadata and documentation capabilities for local activities.

issues.title: Add task_queue information to long_request_latency
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: Feature request to add task_queue name to long_request_latency metrics to help identify which task_queue is experiencing latency issues.

issues.title: Provide last result and last failure to workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for accessing the last result and last failure from workflows that are continued from cron or schedule executions. This data comes from workflow history but should be exposed through the SDK workflow context in a consistent way across all SDKs.

issues.title: Add failure_reason=UnhandledCommand to workflow_task_execution_failed metric
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Add UnhandledCommand as a failure_reason value to the workflow_task_execution_failed metric to enable better alerting and debugging of issues related to high signal rates to executions.

issues.title: Treat Activity start as the first heartbeat time
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Activity heartbeat throttling currently starts after the first heartbeat is sent, but users want it to start from activity begin time so the first actual heartbeat is delayed until 4/5 of the heartbeat timeout. This is especially important for cloud customers where heartbeats are billable.

issues.title: Add StartDelay to ContinueAsNewOptions
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to add StartDelay option to ContinueAsNewOptions for workflows. Currently StartDelay is available in workflow options but not when continuing a workflow as new.

issues.title: Gracefully fail gRPC-message-too-large issues in worker
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: gRPC message-too-large errors should fail tasks gracefully instead of being retried. This requires creating a new WorkflowTaskFailedCause enum, updating SDKs to capture and convert these errors to non-retryable failures, and adding validation tests across platforms.

issues.title: SDK support for activity reset
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to implement activity reset support across all Temporal SDKs. When an activity is reset, it should restart from the beginning, with optional heartbeat clearing. The implementation should handle reset events similarly to pause and cancel operations, allowing users to write exception handlers that can differentiate between interruption types.

issues.title: Expose `StartWorkflowExecutionResponse` fields to `ExecuteWorkflow` API
issues.author: rodrigozhou
issues.summary: ExecuteWorkflow API needs to expose fields from StartWorkflowExecutionResponse, particularly the Started boolean for UseExisting conflict policy and links for Nexus WorkflowRunOperation integration.

issues.title: Warn when the server-provided task start time is fairly different than time SDK begins processing the task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Proposal to issue warnings when server-provided task start times differ significantly from when the SDK begins processing the task, which could indicate clock skew between server and worker or worker processing delays.

issues.title: Show retry policy on activity info
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add retry policy information to activity info exposed to activities, similar to how it's available for workflows. The retry policy can be updated in future features but only applies to successive tasks, not the current one.

issues.title: Apply application failure logging and metrics behaviour according to `ApplicationErrorCategory`
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Introduce ApplicationErrorCategory to enable SDKs to categorize application failures and apply corresponding logging and metrics behavior. This is a cross-SDK feature requiring implementation across multiple SDK languages.

issues.title: Explore ways of testing pre-patched code in SDKs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: SDKs need testing infrastructure for pre-patched workflow code to ensure patches work correctly across different workflow versions and replay scenarios. Current testing only covers new workflows with the latest patch/getVersion code.

issues.title: Remove pinning of @grpc/grpc-js in the TS harness
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: The @grpc/grpc-js library version 1.13.0 fails to connect to the custom HTTP proxy used in TypeScript harness testing, causing proxy-related tests to fail. An override to version 1.10.10 was added as a workaround, but needs investigation to determine if this is a proxy artifact or a broader compatibility issue.

issues.title: Add summary to Nexus operation
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Add Summary field to Nexus operations, similar to the existing Summary support for activities and child workflows. This cross-SDK feature request seeks consistent access to operation metadata across all SDK implementations.

issues.title: Initial Nexus implementation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement Nexus support across all Temporal SDKs and CLI. This is an umbrella tracking issue for implementing a generic Nexus common library for each language and language-specific Temporal SDK implementations.

issues.title: SDK should try to check if activity is completed before sending last buffered heartbeat
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: SDKs should check if an activity has already completed or timed out before sending the final buffered heartbeat to avoid unnecessary temporal_request_failure metric noise.

issues.title: Standardize (where desirable) metrics across SDK languages
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Cross-SDK metrics standardization initiative to identify and reduce unintentional deviation in metrics reporting across different Temporal SDK languages, ensuring consistent observability for multi-language users.

issues.title: Custom metric bucket sizes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users should be able to configure custom bucket sizes for histogram metrics emitted by Temporal SDKs. This feature was already available in some SDKs (Go, Java, PHP) but needed implementation in Core-based SDKs (TypeScript, Python, .NET, Ruby).

issues.title: Expose root workflow execution
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: SDKs need to expose root workflow execution information (workflow ID and run ID) from both workflow info and workflow execution objects, similar to how parent execution is currently exposed. The API now provides this data but SDKs have not yet implemented the exposure across all supported languages.

issues.title: Built-in query responses should use "RawValue"
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Built-in query responses need to return RawValue from default converters instead of structures to avoid requiring users to have a specific converter configured. This is a backwards-incompatible change affecting multiple SDKs.

issues.title: "RawValue" support for non-converted payloads
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: SDKs need to support a 'RawValue' wrapper that passes payloads through codec processing without applying traditional payload conversion, enabling dynamic deserialization and built-in queries like workflow metadata.

issues.title: Heartbeating activities should be interrupted when the activities are paused.
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to interrupt long-running heartbeating activities when paused via `temporal activity pause` command. Users should be able to distinguish pause interruption from cancellation, as they may require different handling logic.

issues.title: Research and implement a way to test and make sure history is still compatible across SDK versions
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Need to establish a formal testing approach to verify that workflow histories remain compatible across SDK versions and will continue to be in the future. Current practices are fragmented across different SDKs and languages.

issues.title: Research/solve truncating failure stack traces SDK-side so they don't get truncated server side
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Server truncates oversized failures but cannot truncate stack traces in encoded attributes, dropping the entire message and trace. Need SDK-side stack trace truncation with configurable limits and a smart algorithm that removes middle frames while preserving context.

issues.title: Expose Workflow cancel cause/reason
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Expose the cancellation cause/reason from WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes to SDK users, both when workflows receive cancellations and when clients issue cancellations. This feature needs implementation across all Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: Add features test for cloud API key over data plane
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a features test for cloud API key authentication over the data plane. The test should run a workflow using Temporal Cloud with an API key for authentication without manually setting namespace headers.

issues.title: Natively support musl-based environments
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add native support for musl-based environments across Temporal SDKs and tooling. This includes publishing musl-specific libraries for core-based SDKs, building musl binaries for the time-skipping test server, and updating temporal.download to support musl platform detection.

issues.title: Task Queue Priority Options/Annotations
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Feature request to implement task queue priority options/annotations across SDKs. The API changes were introduced in api#513 and Go SDK has a reference implementation in sdk-go#1792. This requires passing through new priority-related options to the task queue in all SDK implementations.

issues.title: Add `temporalNamespace` tag to all tracing spans
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a `temporalNamespace` tag to all distributed tracing spans across SDKs to provide namespace context in observability data.

issues.title: Uniformize `patched()` API in all SDKs
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Standardize the `patched()` and `deprecatePatch()` APIs across all Temporal SDKs with consistent behavior (memoized), while maintaining backward compatibility with existing versioning APIs like `GetVersion()`. The memoized flag should be stored in workflow history markers and inconsistent usage should trigger non-determinism errors.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add describe() method to ExternalWorkflowHanlde
issues.author: koliaVasyliv
issues.summary: User requests a describe() method for ExternalWorkflowHandle to retrieve workflow status without requiring an extra activity. Feature requires server-side support before SDK implementation.

issues.title: Add utility function to classify exceptions as failing the workflow vs failing the task
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Add a utility function to classify exceptions as either workflow-exiting or task-failing exceptions. This helps developers distinguish between exceptions that terminate the workflow versus those that cause automatic retries.

issues.title: Allow UI port to be specified in programmatic dev server
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Allow users to specify a custom UI port when enabling the dev server in programmatic configuration. Currently, SDKs don't expose the UI port customization option even though it's available in the underlying implementation.

issues.title: Support Ruby in this features repo
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add Ruby as a first-class supported language in the temporalio-features repository, including implementation of example features in Ruby to guide users and demonstrate SDK capabilities.

issues.title: [Features Platform] continue_as_new/continue_as_same feature does not pass against cloud
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: The continue_as_new/continue_as_same feature fails in cloud environments with deadline exceeded and workflow execution already started exceptions. The workflow exits prematurely and assertions fail before completion, indicating timing issues with the feature's cloud integration.

issues.title: [Features Platform] Remove TEMPORAL_FEATURES_DISABLE_WORKFLOW_COMPLETION_CHECK workaround
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: A workaround environment variable `TEMPORAL_FEATURES_DISABLE_WORKFLOW_COMPLETION_CHECK` was introduced to bypass test failures in cloud where workflows appear to still be running according to ListWorkflow APIs even after they complete. This workaround needs to be removed by properly resolving the underlying stale data issue.

issues.title: [Features Platform] PHP schedule/basic fails when run against cloud
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: PHP schedule/basic test fails when run against cloud due to marshalling errors with ScheduleSpec.jitter field, which appears to be receiving null values that cannot be properly deserialized.

issues.title: Special behavior for Temporal built-in prefixes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: All SDKs need to prevent registration of workflows, activities, Nexus operations, task queues, signals, queries, and updates with the reserved `__temporal_` prefix, and handle reserved queries like `__stack_trace` without interceptors.

issues.title: Add fine control for workflow cache eviction
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: Request for fine-grained control over workflow cache eviction policies. Users want to optimize memory usage by evicting long-running workflows and keeping recently-queried workflows cached to avoid expensive history replay on post-close queries.

issues.title: Access to workflow/activity instance created by Temporal from workflow/activity context where applicable
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to expose workflow and activity instances created by Temporal from their respective contexts, allowing users (e.g., via interceptors) to access the actual class instance. Needs implementation across Java, Python, .NET, Ruby, and PHP SDKs, with future support for Nexus.

issues.title: Concept of "workflow local" value
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need a thread-local-like mechanism to access and mutate workflow-specific values across SDKs. This feature already exists in Java but needs to be implemented in Go, Python, .NET, Ruby, and PHP to provide a consistent way to manage state within workflows and interceptors.

issues.title: SDK should provide a native query builder
issues.author: OpeOnikute
issues.summary: Feature request for a native query builder in Temporal SDKs to safely construct visibility API queries instead of string concatenation. The user has already open-sourced a working Go implementation and advocates for including it in official repositories for better discoverability and support.

issues.title: Support full query failure structure
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: SDKs need to implement support for full query failure structure in the new `failure` field on query responses. Workers should set converted query failures while maintaining backward compatibility by keeping `error_message` aligned with `failure.message`. Clients should check for `QueryFailedFailure` gRPC details and set them as the cause of returned errors.

issues.title: Create FIFO mutex mechanism for locking access to some part of a workflow
issues.author: Noot-tooN
issues.summary: Feature request for a FIFO mutex mechanism to lock critical sections of workflow code based on a key. The request seeks built-in support for cross-workflow locking to ensure sequential execution of operations for specific users or entities (e.g., preventing concurrent DB updates for the same user across different workflow instances).

issues.title: Provide flag to tell the update handler that the handling is from a re-apply
issues.author: longquanzheng
issues.summary: Feature request to provide a flag indicating whether an update handler is being invoked from a re-applied update during workflow reset/replay. This is needed to prevent activity failures when updates are retried after being marked as admitted to the client.

issues.title: Tag workflow_failed counter metric with exception type
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to add exception type tagging to the workflow_failed counter metric to allow users to filter and alert on unexpected failures while distinguishing intentional business logic failures.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Session support
issues.author: schickling
issues.summary: Request for Sessions support in TypeScript SDK, similar to the Go SDK implementation. Sessions provide concurrency control and worker-specific task queue patterns for managing activity execution affinity.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add Mutable Side Effect in Core based SDKs
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to add mutable side effect support in core-based SDKs. The discussion evaluates whether mutable side effects provide sufficient value over local activities, with community debate on use cases and implementation priorities.

issues.title: Add `WorkflowExecutionInfo.pendingActivities`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Add a `pendingActivities` field to `WorkflowExecutionInfo` that provides all activity payload fields fully decoded and timestamps converted to appropriate formats.

issues.title: Include structured command/event diff/items in non-determinism error
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement structured command/event diff representation in non-determinism errors across SDKs. Currently, error messages are obscure and don't clearly explain what command was expected versus what actually occurred during workflow replay.

issues.title: Add WorkflowIdConflictPolicy in child workflow options
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to add WorkflowIdConflictPolicy support in child workflow options across all SDKs. Currently, developers lack built-in support for handling workflow ID conflicts in child workflows, requiring complex workarounds and manual conflict resolution.

issues.title: Add "summary" metadata to scheduled Nexus operations
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Add support for setting a 'summary' metadata field on scheduled Nexus operations in workflows, similar to existing support for timers, child workflows, and activities.

issues.title: allow reset API to bring new signals as atomic operation
issues.author: longquanzheng
issues.summary: Feature request to allow the reset API to bring new signals as an atomic operation. This would enable use cases like skipping activities post-reset, selectively preserving specific signals, or notifying workflows they're in a reset state.

issues.title: Waiting on update result should auto-skip time in time-skipping environments
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to auto-skip time when waiting on update results in time-skipping test environments, similar to existing behavior for workflow results. Team discussion concluded this approach is problematic due to race conditions and concurrent update execution, with focus shifting to alternative solutions like server-side time-skipping control or documentation.

issues.title: Allow queries to target a certain event number in replayers (and maybe other interactions)
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Allow replayers to execute queries at specific task boundaries (event numbers), enabling query execution at every task boundary during workflow replay.

issues.title: Workflow annotations for versioning
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Add workflow annotations for versioning-3 to mark workflows as pinned, preventing immediate migration to new versions and allowing short-running workflows to avoid patching when pinned. Requires language-specific annotations or a programmatic API invoked during the first workflow task.

issues.title: Call ShutdownWorker API on worker shutdown
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement calls to the new server-side ShutdownWorker API when workers shut down, with proper error handling to ignore unimplemented errors while logging other failures.

issues.title: Add all java metrics to core/python.
issues.author: mukul-atomicwork
issues.summary: Python SDK is missing several metrics that are available in Java SDK. Out of 32 metrics, only 18 are currently available for Python, creating an incompleteness in the SDK's observability capabilities.

issues.title: Allow SDKs to support connecting to multiple endpoints for Multi-region Namespaces
issues.author: atihkin
issues.summary: Allow SDKs to connect to multiple endpoints for Multi-region Namespaces and perform health checks on both endpoints. SDKs should dynamically route requests to the active endpoint based on namespace failover information from the Temporal server.

issues.title: Bidirectional linking of workflows through activity
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add support for bidirectional linking of workflows started from activities, allowing users to maintain the relationship between parent and child workflows when starting them via activity clients instead of child workflows. Links should be established in activity completion events and support signals/updates as well.

issues.title: Centralize dynamic config
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: The features repository has hardcoded dynamic config values in run.go and a separate docker.yaml file. This issue requests consolidating these into a single YAML configuration file to ensure consistency and allow the server team to reference the same options for nightly pipeline testing.

issues.title: High-level task queue describe call with default-build-ID stats
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for describing task queues with stats from the high-level client. The feature requires a new describe call that returns task queue information including pollers and statistics, with configurable options for reporting stats and poller info.

issues.title: Support local_activity_X based metrics in Core-based SDKs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Align local_activity_ metrics in Core with Go and Java SDKs by making them separate from activity_ metrics by default, with an opt-in option to revert to current behavior. All Core-based SDKs must expose this option and include clear release notes about the metric behavior change.

issues.title: Add feature tests for .NET HTTP proxy support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add feature tests for .NET HTTP proxy support following the implementation in sdk-dotnet#318. Tests needed for both basic HTTP proxy and HTTP proxy authentication scenarios.

issues.title: Support upgrading handlers/loops easier
issues.author: recht
issues.summary: Request for easier signal handler upgrades in long-running workflows. Currently, workflow.GetVersion locks into a specific behavior, but users want a way to upgrade signal handler code so new signals use the latest version while replaying history with the version used at that time.

issues.title: Expose start delay in child workflow options
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to expose start delay option for child workflows to match client workflow functionality. This would allow delayed child workflow execution without requiring long timers at the top level, preserving parent-child relationships and UI traceability.

issues.title: Support schedule search attribute update
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for updating search attributes on schedules during schedule update operations. This feature allows schedules to have their search attributes modified, similar to how workflow start actions could be updated.

issues.title: Support replaying past last successful workflow task completion
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Users cannot replay workflows past the last WORKFLOW_TASK_COMPLETED event, making it difficult to debug workflow task failures. The feature request asks for replay capability beyond the last successful task completion.

issues.title: Support "query" when listing schedules
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for the `query` option when listing schedules across all SDKs, matching the existing functionality available for listing workflows.

issues.title: Cancel and Signal should still propagate to child workflows after child CAN'ed
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Child workflows started via CAN (continue as new) do not receive explicit cancel and signal requests from parent workflows, even though they should propagate through the child chain. The server should treat run_id with child_workflow_only flag the same way as first_execution_run_id in client APIs.

issues.title: Warn when activities dangle
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Add warnings when activities dangle (remain unresolved) after a workflow closes or continues as new, similar to existing warnings for signals and updates. The request also suggests considering similar warnings for child workflows, external signals, nexus, and other async operations that should not be abandoned.

issues.title: Workflow-friendly concurrency control
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Cross-SDK feature for deterministic, reentrant concurrency control (mutex/semaphore) designed to work within workflow coroutines, signal handlers, and update handlers.

issues.title: Warn or error when update handlers dangle across CAN or workflow exit
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to add warnings or errors when update handlers are not properly awaited and dangle across cancellation or workflow exit points, preventing resource leaks and unhandled state changes.

issues.title: Allow listing and filtering workflows based on current failures.
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to enable listing and filtering workflows based on current failures, allowing batch operations like reset or pause on workflows matching specific failure patterns. Proposes adding search attributes to track failures such as activity retry counts, error types, and stuck duration.

issues.title: Easy search attributes in dev server
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add easy search attribute registration to the dev server via CLI, with SDK implementations needed across TypeScript, Go, and other languages. This is a cross-SDK initiative with per-language tracking tickets.

issues.title: Feature test for Update + Workflow Reset
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Add comprehensive feature tests across all SDKs for the Update + Workflow Reset functionality, including tests for reapplied updates being accepted/rejected after reset and updates reapplied before completion.

issues.title: Provide sample to show  per workflow interceptor instead of global
issues.author: ktenzer
issues.summary: Request for a sample demonstrating per-workflow interceptor configuration. Currently, interceptors are registered globally at the worker factory level, but users need the ability to apply different interceptor behavior to specific workflows or subsets of workflows.

issues.title: GetWorkflowHistory payload size exceeds limit for a single page
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: GetWorkflowHistory can return a single page of history that exceeds gRPC payload limits (e.g., 4MB), putting workflows into an unrecoverable state. The request seeks solutions such as smaller pagination or a payload store.

issues.title: User metadata and workflow metadata query
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add user-provided metadata that's visible in UI/CLI for workflows, including static metadata at workflow start, updateable current details, metadata queries with signal/query/update information, and metadata for timers and activities.

issues.title: Wrap GRPC::CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED in an SDK Timeout exception for Update
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Create a common SDK exception for workflow updates that wraps gRPC CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED status codes, representing RPC timeout or cancellation rather than update-specific timeout.

issues.title: Decide/apply/clarify ambiguous failure behavior in signals and workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Clarify and standardize how SDKs handle exceptions when both workflow functions and signal handlers throw exceptions in the same task, determining precedence and consistency across implementations.

issues.title: Do not set workflow completion until after all coroutines have settled in the task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Core-based SDKs currently set workflow completion immediately upon return and discard post-completion commands, unlike Go/Java SDKs which allow coroutines to settle first. This issue proposes adopting the Go/Java behavior to handle post-completion commands correctly using SDK flags for backwards compatibility.

issues.title: Call describe namespace on worker start
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add namespace validation on worker startup by calling describe namespace to ensure the user has access to the namespace and it exists. This is a consistency enhancement across SDKs, with Go already implemented and Java needing completion.

issues.title: Set Temporal-Namespace header on every gRPC request
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a Temporal-Namespace header (gRPC metadata) to every namespace-specific gRPC request across all SDKs. This requires extracting the namespace from request objects and setting it via interceptors, with validation to ensure new RPCs don't miss this header.

issues.title: TestWorkflowEnvironment - fail tests on workflow task failures
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Feature request to add support for failing tests when workflow task failures occur in TestWorkflowEnvironment. Needs clarification on scope (SDK coverage) and whether this should be a worker option rather than environment configuration.

issues.title: Worker client TLS certificate update
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need the ability to update TLS certificates for a running worker without requiring a shutdown. This is a cross-SDK feature request to enable certificate rotation on active worker instances.

issues.title: Tests to ensure dev-server/test-server processes properly shut down
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add CI tests across SDKs to verify that dev-server and test-server processes are properly shut down when requested. Various reports indicate processes are not being killed on shutdown across different languages and OS/arch combinations.

issues.title: Make start_update users aware that it's synchronous w/ worker.
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: The start_update API is synchronous and blocks waiting for the remote worker to accept the update, which misleads users into thinking it's fully asynchronous like start_activity and start_workflow. Users should be forced to explicitly specify what stage they're waiting for (ACCEPTED or COMPLETED) to make the blocking behavior clear.

issues.title: Full history decode utility
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need a standardized utility across all Temporal SDKs to decode all payloads in a history object. Currently only Go and Ruby have this functionality exposed through payload visitors, and other SDKs lack this capability.

issues.title: Updates getting dropped after continue as new
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Updates getting dropped after continue-as-new in workflows. The issue occurs when near-simultaneous updates race with workflow continuation, and the SDK doesn't prevent or clearly inform users about this behavior. Users need better SDK support or facilities to track outstanding updates.

issues.title: Show update handler and ID in logging context
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Users need better logging context to identify which handler (update, signal, query) is executing and the update ID, making it easier to debug and correlate logs with specific operations in production environments.

issues.title: [Sample] Add samples showing certificate replacement
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to add SDK samples demonstrating how to replace mTLS certificates at runtime without application restart. Useful for certificate rotation and updates in production environments.

issues.title: Customize activity failure logging (and more?)
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need a way to customize or disable implicit activity failure logging to support patterns like activity-retry-based-polling where some failures are intentional. The request is to allow users to control logging behavior while still enabling their own custom logging approaches.

issues.title: Expose attempts in `ActivityFailure`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to expose the number of activity attempts in `ActivityFailure` so workflows can access retry information. Currently, this data exists in the `ActivityTaskStarted` event but isn't exposed to users.

issues.title: TypeScript - TODO after core
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Accidental issue created due to clicking the wrong button in the UI. No actual feature request or bug report.

issues.title: StickyTaskQueueDrainTimeout
issues.author: tlalfano
issues.summary: Add an option to drain sticky task queue during graceful worker shutdown. This allows the worker to stop polling the normal task queue and only poll the sticky task queue to complete workflows while shutting down, improving shutdown behavior.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide worker status
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to provide worker status information across all SDKs, allowing users to check worker health and programmatically react to status changes like activity/workflow slot usage, cache size, polling status, and server reachability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Consider TLS handshake failures as worker-fatal errors
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to treat TLS handshake failures as worker-fatal errors instead of retrying indefinitely. TLS failures should be differentiated from normal connection failures and cause the worker to fail after normal retry logic is exhausted.

issues.title: Enable users to easily run samples in Cloud
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Add a defaultConnection() static method to all SDKs that uses localhost by default but can be configured via environment variables or config files to connect to Temporal Cloud, enabling users to easily switch samples between local and cloud environments.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Feature test confirming unhandled-command update behavior
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request for SDK test coverage confirming that workflow updates are processed with higher priority than the main workflow completion, including handling of unhandled commands and proper coroutine ordering when updates arrive during task processing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] provide a way to create a Temporal schedule which runs every last day of the month
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: Customer request for Temporal Schedules to support running on the last day of each month. This requires extending the Schedule feature to handle this specific recurring pattern, which is not currently supported.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Run history compatibility checks for all SDKs and all features
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Implement history compatibility testing for all SDKs (TypeScript, Python, .NET) and all features to ensure new SDK releases maintain compatibility with older SDK-recorded histories. Currently supported only in Go and Java.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Implement activity task poll limit
issues.author: madhav2302
issues.summary: User requests the ability to limit the number of activity tasks that a worker polls, enabling graceful shutdown and non-multi-tenant configurations. The feature would prevent workers from accepting new tasks while long-running activities complete without losing progress.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow activity to specify backoff interval via failure
issues.author: yiminc
issues.summary: Feature request to allow activities to specify backoff intervals for retries when returning failures, leveraging server-side support already implemented.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Environment configuration
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support environment variable and file-based configuration for CLI and SDKs across all Temporal language implementations. This unified configuration approach should allow both env vars and config files (with vars overriding files) to initialize client connections.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Cloud Ops API Client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to integrate the Cloud Ops API client into Temporal SDKs. This involves creating high-level cloud clients separate from existing SDK clients while sharing underlying gRPC service mechanisms across all language SDKs.

issues.title: Stack traces with source mappings in the UI
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Feature request to enable users to see source code mappings for workflow events in the UI, allowing them to relate events back to their source code for easier debugging. TypeScript SDK already has this capability via enhanced stack traces; other language implementations need standardization.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support for WorkflowIdConflictPolicy
issues.author: stephanos
issues.summary: Add support for the new WorkflowIdConflictPolicy field in Start Workflow and Signal-with-Start APIs across all SDKs. This policy controls behavior when a workflow ID conflicts with running workflows, complementing the existing WorkflowIdReusePolicy which applies to closed workflows.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Serialization context for codecs and converters
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to add serialization context to codecs and converters, allowing users to access payload context details (like workflow ID) during serialization/deserialization. This enables use cases such as signing payloads with workflow IDs to protect against replay attacks, similar to existing Java SDK implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] SDK should not return an update handle if the update has not reached the desired state
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: SDKs currently return update handles even when the update hasn't reached the desired lifecycle stage, which is dangerous because updates aren't durable until accepted. The fix requires SDKs to poll the update request until it reaches the desired state before returning the handle to the user.

issues.title: [Feature Request] SDK clients should set a UpdateID on any update request even if the user did not specify one.
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: SDK clients should automatically generate and set an UpdateID on update requests even when users don't provide one, enabling proper deduplication of retried requests across all Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: Add actions metrics dashboard
issues.author: yiminc
issues.summary: Add a dashboard to expose the action metrics that the server is emitting, similar to existing dashboards.

issues.title: Add SLA dashboard using SDK/client metrics
issues.author: yiminc
issues.summary: Users need an SLA dashboard to monitor error codes and SDK/worker metrics, helping track Service Level Agreements based on real SDK metrics in a metrics visualization tool.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow Update Get-Status (and Wait-For-Stage) Capability
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a GetStatus() method to workflow update handles that allows users to check the current status of an update and optionally wait for it to reach a specific stage, with WorkflowUpdateInfo returning the stage and result if available.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Unknown SDK flag should behave consistently across SDK
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: SDKs currently handle unknown SDK flags inconsistently on replaysome fail the workflow task while others ignore the flag. The request is to standardize behavior across all SDKs to prevent workflows from entering inconsistent states.

issues.title: [Feature Request] API key client option
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add API key client option to all SDKs and CLI tools that creates a Bearer token Authorization header. This feature is needed for self-hosted setups and cloud deployments where API key authentication is required.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow force complete current workflow task when localActivity is completed or failed
issues.author: longquanzheng
issues.summary: Request to allow workflows to force complete the current workflow task when local activities finish, enabling faster query and signal processing. Currently workflow tasks wait up to 80% of the timeout (10s) before completing, causing delays.

issues.title: [Bug] Incomplete Span Reporting: Only RunActivity Spans Sent When Workflow Triggered via scheduler
issues.author: alonwengierko
issues.summary: When workflows are triggered via scheduler, only RunActivity spans are reported in distributed tracing instead of all expected spans (StartWorkflow, RunWorkflow, StartActivity, RunActivity, CompleteWorkflow) that appear when workflows are started manually.

issues.title: [Bug] Why doesn't this repo trigger TS barfing on null activity timeouts?
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Features test suite failed to catch a TS SDK bug involving null activity timeouts that was introduced by proto changes. The bug is reproducible with the exact same SDK version and code in a hello world sample but not when running the same code within the features test framework.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose next retry delay on Application Failure in all SDKs
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add support for exposing next retry delay on ApplicationFailure across all Temporal SDKs and local activities. This feature was added to the API but needs to be implemented in Python, PHP SDKs and verified in other SDKs.

issues.title: RestartWorkflow on workflow task failure
issues.author: elb3k
issues.summary: Request for a new PanicPolicy option to automatically restart workflows from the beginning when non-deterministic errors occur, particularly useful for finite-state machine workflows with frequent small changes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Disable eager activities if task queue rate limits is set
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Server does not properly rate limit eager activities. SDKs need to disable eager activities when task queue rate limits are configured until the server can address this limitation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] WorkflowService API to update activity rate limit on a task queue
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request for a WorkflowService API to allow dynamic updates to activity rate limits on a task queue. Currently, rate limits are set by activity pollers via TaskQueueMetadata, causing inconsistency when different workers have different configurations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow-init support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add workflow initialization support that allows workflows to run setup code before start to configure handlers and use workflow input, without returning values. Feature needs implementation across SDKs (PHP, TypeScript, Java, Python, Go) with language-specific approaches.

issues.title: Custom Markers for Workflow History/Timeline
issues.author: freisenhauer
issues.summary: Request to add custom marker events to workflow history/timeline for recording workflow-specific decisions and pivotal events without the constraints of signals or activities. Currently users work around this by exposing information through queries.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Do not require other Activity timeouts when Heartbeat timeout is specified
issues.author: husam-e
issues.summary: Feature request to allow activities to omit StartToClose or ScheduleToClose timeouts when a Heartbeat timeout is configured, enabling indefinite/long-running activities without requiring arbitrary large timeout values.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use macOS M1/ARM runners for all SDK CI
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Enable macOS M1/ARM runners for CI testing across all Temporal SDKs. GitHub Actions now supports M1 runners with reasonable costs, and SDKs should test on all supported platforms including macOS ARM.

issues.title: Rust SDK Support
issues.author: liamwh
issues.summary: User requests support for a Rust SDK for Temporal. The team acknowledges this is on their radar but hasn't committed to a production release yet, directing users to track the core SDK issue for updates.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Worker tracing should upsert header with outer span
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to have worker tracing interceptors automatically create spans for schedules/workflows and upsert them into workflow headers, with options to opt-out. After discussion, the team identified implementation challenges around span lifecycle, lack of universal interceptor hooks for persisting data, and header mutation constraints across SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add temporal_worker_task_slots_total metric
issues.author: ghaskins
issues.summary: Request to expose a total worker task slots metric alongside the existing available slots metric to enable better visualization and monitoring of task slot utilization across worker nodes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Worker dynamic config
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to allow users to dynamically modify worker configurations (such as number of pollers and slots) while a worker is running, with tracking across multiple SDK implementations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Whitelist Retryable Error Types
issues.author: sebl1ngt0n
issues.summary: Feature request to add a whitelist mechanism for retryable error types in RetryPolicy, allowing developers to specify which error types should trigger retries instead of only blacklisting non-retryable errors.

issues.title: logback-classic-1.2.9.jar: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two high-severity vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-6481, CVE-2023-6378) in logback-classic 1.2.9 and logback-core 1.2.9 allow Denial-of-Service attacks via poisoned serialized data. Both vulnerabilities have CVSS scores of 7.5 and can be fixed by upgrading to logback 1.2.13.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Dynamic Display Name for Activities in Temporal Go
issues.author: mohanrajreese
issues.summary: Request to enable dynamic display names for activities in Temporal Go SDK to differentiate multiple invocations of the same activity method with different parameters, improving visibility and management in the Temporal UI.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose API to list enabled features for a namespace
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to expose a gRPC API that allows clients to query which features (schedules, versioning, sync update) are enabled for a specific namespace, since these features can be toggled on and off per namespace but there's currently no way for clients to discover this information.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Every SDK needs a DataDog sample for sending metrics and traces to DataDog agent
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to create DataDog integration samples for all Temporal SDKs demonstrating metrics and tracing integration with DataDog agents. Currently users struggle to integrate DataDog metrics (via Prometheus) and distributed tracing without clear examples.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow Continue-as-New from update handlers
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to allow Continue-as-New from update handlers, similar to how it works in signal handlers. The feature was requested across multiple SDKs but was ultimately decided against due to design concerns around precedence and exception handling.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Timer duration "jitter" out of box utility
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Feature request to add built-in timer jitter utility to SDKs. Users currently must implement their own jitter functions to prevent large numbers of timers from firing simultaneously, which often leads to non-deterministic issues.

issues.title: Support an option to disable "Close" timeouts for indefinitely running Activities
issues.author: ghaskins
issues.summary: Request for a first-class way to disable StartToClose and ScheduleToClose timeouts in Activities to support indefinitely running Activities that execute until explicitly canceled.

issues.title: Add metric for payload size for input/output/signal of workflow/activity
issues.author: longquanzheng
issues.summary: Request to add metrics for tracking payload sizes of workflow/activity input/output/signals to help users monitor approaching the 2MB size limit before hitting it, with optional logging for which workflow IDs and events are approaching the limit.

issues.title: Community SDKs?
issues.author: Nezteb
issues.summary: User requests guidance on using Temporal with Elixir through community SDKs. Asks for either a maintained list of community SDK implementations or documentation on generating unofficial clients from gRPC definitions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add an Eager Workflow Start test for Cloud
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Add an end-to-end test for Eager Workflow Start (EWS) in Cloud that verifies the first workflow task is eagerly dispatched to a local worker without matching delays or database round trips.

issues.title: go.temporal.io/api-v1.24.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Security vulnerability CVE-2023-39325 (CVSS 7.5) in golang.org/x/net v0.14.0 transitive dependency causes excessive server resource consumption through malicious HTTP/2 client requests. The vulnerability affects go.temporal.io/api-v1.24.0 with no direct remediation available in the direct dependency.

issues.title: xunit.assert.2.5.3.nupkg: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two vulnerabilities detected in transitive dependencies of xunit.assert 2.5.3 used in the .NET SDK features project. CVE-2019-0820 (severity 7.5) affects System.Text.RegularExpressions 4.3.0 causing denial of service, and CVE-2018-8292 (severity 5.3) affects System.Net.Http 4.3.0 exposing authentication information in redirects.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Work around gRPC message size limit for task completion
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: gRPC message size limits cause task completion failures when completing many medium-payload activities in a single task. The proposed solution is to implement multi-RPC partial task completion support.

issues.title: [Features Platform] Make it possible to configure client interceptors in typescript
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: The features harness for TypeScript doesn't provide an API for feature authors to configure client interceptors in WorkflowClientOptions, unlike the Go implementation which allows passing client options when instantiating the feature.

issues.title: google.golang.org/grpc-v1.57.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: HTTP/2 vulnerability (CVE-2023-39325) in golang.org/x/net-v0.14.0 affecting gRPC-v1.57.0 allows malicious clients to consume excessive server resources through rapid request creation and reset. The issue was auto-closed as the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose AdminService api in sdks
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to expose AdminService API in SDKs for programmatic access to internal admin operations like task refresh. Team decided this cannot be exposed as it's internal server API, but users can generate gRPC clients or use the Go server as a library as a workaround.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Worker Pause
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add worker pause/unpause functionality that allows workers to stop polling for new work without shutting down, useful for scenarios like managing resource constraints dynamically.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow SDKs to create Schedule specs from tctl json structure
issues.author: XerxesDGreat
issues.summary: Feature request to allow SDKs to create Schedule specs from JSON structures (like tctl uses) instead of requiring cumbersome object construction. This would enable consistent schedule definitions across languages, easier configuration management, and reduced risk of misconfiguration.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add encryption codec to SDK
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to simplify encryption setup in Temporal SDKs by providing built-in codec helpers. Users find the current encryption implementation complex and would prefer a more plug-and-play approach with just key and algorithm configuration.

issues.title: Feature Request] Add delay to workflow start options
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add a delay/start delay field to workflow start options, allowing workflows to be scheduled to start at a future time. This capability exists in the Temporal API but is missing from SDK workflow options across all language SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Typed Search Attributes
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to implement typed search attributes across all Temporal SDKs (Go, Java, TypeScript, Python, .NET, PHP). This enhancement provides type-safe search attribute handling following a cross-SDK proposal.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Worker Slot & Polling Auto-Tuning
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request for worker auto-tuning to maximize resource utilization by automatically configuring worker slots and polling parameters. Design still needs to be finalized with implementations planned across all SDKs (Go, Java, Core, TypeScript, Python, .NET).

issues.title: github.com/temporalio/features/features-v1.0.0: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two security vulnerabilities (CVE-2019-0205 and CVE-2019-0210) were discovered in the Apache Thrift library (version 0.12.0 and earlier) as a transitive dependency through uber-go/tally. Both vulnerabilities have high severity (CVSS 7.5) and affect availability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use codecs for headers in all SDKs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement codec support for headers across all SDKs. Currently, .NET and Ruby SDKs support this, but Go, Java, TypeScript, and Python need investigation or implementation to align behavior.

issues.title: [Bug] bugs/go/child_workflow_cancel_panic flaky
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: The 'bugs/go/child_workflow_cancel_panic' feature test flakes intermittently with a nondeterministic workflow error during replay. The error indicates an extra CancelTimer command is being replayed, causing the test to fail.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Unified client gRPC retry periods
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Standardize gRPC retry periods across all Temporal SDKs to handle namespace migrations and ensure consistent behavior. Currently, retry durations vary significantly between SDKs (TypeScript Client: ~2s, Java Client: 60s), and some SDKs don't retry initial connections.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support reason for Cancel and Terminate workflow API
issues.author: longquanzheng
issues.summary: Support passing and retrieving reason/details for both Terminate and Cancel workflow APIs. Currently, Terminate allows passing a reason that is stored in the terminate event, but the Client cannot retrieve it; Cancel doesn't support reasons at all.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support for HTTP CONNECT proxies in SDKs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add HTTP CONNECT proxy support across Temporal SDKs. Most SDKs already have support but need documentation; TypeScript and .NET implementations are still pending.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Configurable workflow failure exception types
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow users configure which exception types should fail workflows versus tasks across SDKs. Go and Java partially implement this; Java, TypeScript, and Python still need worker-level configuration options.

issues.title: [Feature Request] SDK name and version on workflow tasks
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add SDK name and version metadata to workflow tasks, similar to the client-name and client-version gRPC headers. This allows tracking which SDK version processed each task.

issues.title: [Bug] Stale workflows in sdk-ci.a2dd6 namespace
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Stale workflows are accumulating in the sdk-ci.a2dd6 namespace and need cleanup. Additionally, a reasonable schedule-to-close timeout (e.g., 1 day) should be set on all workflows to prevent future accumulation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add Client method for non blocking try-get-result
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request for a non-blocking method to check workflow result status. Users currently must wait for `workflowHandle.result()` to complete; they need a way to make a single request that returns immediately with an error if the workflow hasn't completed yet.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Block when workflow commands are produced in a read only context
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to prevent workflow commands from being produced in read-only contexts (query handlers and update validators). Should fail the workflow task gracefully through language-appropriate errors (panic in Go, exceptions in Java) rather than failing the entire workflow.

issues.title: common-1.5.2.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Prototype pollution vulnerability in protobufjs 7.1.2 (CVE-2023-36665) with CVSS 5.5 severity, allowing attackers to pollute Object.prototype through untrusted protobuf messages.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow Update SDK integration - Public Preview
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Tracking cross-SDK implementation of Workflow Update feature for public preview. This meta-issue tracks the feature across Go, Java, TypeScript, Python, .NET, PHP, and Ruby SDKs, including critical requirements for determinism when replaying updates.

issues.title: Safe Deploys API - Public Preview
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Public preview of the Safe Deploys API for worker versioning, enabling safe deployment of workflow and activity code changes across all Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose UpdateID in an update handler
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to expose UpdateID in workflow update handlers, allowing users to access the unique identifier of an update request within handler logic for use cases like continue-as-new, targeted update cancellation, and business process tracking.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add feature that tests for update deduplication
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to add test cases demonstrating update deduplication in Java and Go SDKs. Updates with duplicate IDs targeting the same workflow should only execute once.

issues.title: guava-31.1-jre.jar: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.1)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Guava 31.1-jre contains a high-severity vulnerability (CVE-2023-2976) in FileBackedOutputStream that allows unauthorized file access via the shared Java temporary directory on Unix systems. Upgrade to version 32.0.1-android to resolve.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Harness history checker should have easier way to ignore new fields
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: The features harness history checker breaks on compatible changes like adding new fields to history events. Users need an easy way to mark certain fields as acceptable additions to current history that weren't in stored static history.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Temporal exceptions from converters and codecs should fail the workflow not task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to fail the entire workflow when a Temporal error occurs in a converter or codec, rather than just failing the individual task. Currently most SDKs only fail the task, but the desired behavior is workflow-level failure.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add SDK side metrics for Update
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to add SDK-side metrics for the Update API, including UpdateRejected, UpdateAccepted, UpdateCompletedSuccess, and UpdateCompletedFailure. Discussion centers on whether these metrics are useful enough to add given the existing metric quantity and consistency with other features like signals and queries.

issues.title: [Feature Request]  Update feature tests
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Add feature tests for the update workflow capability across multiple SDK languages (Go, Java, TypeScript, Python, and .NET). Some SDKs already have tests implemented, while others still need them.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Write spec for graceful worker shutdown
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Write a specification for graceful worker shutdown behavior that is consistent across all SDKs. Different SDKs currently handle graceful shutdown differently, particularly regarding when activities are canceled and how the grace period is applied.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose TemporalScheduledStartTime search attribute as typed datetime from workflow info
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose TemporalScheduledStartTime search attribute as a typed datetime in workflow info instead of requiring users to work with string names.

issues.title: Update API: support not writing history when calling external failure
issues.author: longquanzheng
issues.summary: The Update API currently writes failure events to history even when external calls fail without workflow mutations, causing rapid history bloat. The request is to support a pattern where failed external calls don't generate history events, enabling scalable "short update" operations that act like RPCs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Return input when describing WE
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to include workflow input in the describe() response. Currently users must separately fetch history and decode payloads to get input parameters; the request proposes adding input as a decoded array to the describe() call response.

issues.title: json-path-2.6.0.jar: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: The temporalio-features repository has 2 security vulnerabilities in json-path-2.6.0.jar and its transitive dependency json-smart-2.4.7.jar. CVE-2023-1370 is a high-severity stack overflow in JSON parsing, while CVE-2023-51074 is a medium-severity stack overflow in the Criteria.parse() method.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose build ID via WorkflowInfo.
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to expose build ID via WorkflowInfo to help users handle workflow determinism breaks. Users need to identify which build version generated a workflow history so they can conditionally apply logic without using versioning APIs when multiple build versions coexist.

issues.title: worker-1.5.2.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
